creator: amb@mit.edu
text:
The request: add an HTTP method selector to the SOAP/XML-RPC sampler such that
arbitrary blobs of XML can be sent along with any HTTP request.  (Currently it
just uses a hardcoded POST call.)

The rationale: many newly-developed web services I find myself implementing
tests against take XML input to non-POST calls; it's possible to use the file
upload functionality in the HTTP sampler to supply this input for POST and PUT
(as of nightly build r543291), but not any other methods; generally speaking,
using the SOAP/XML-RPC sampler would also be a much cleaner way of implementing
such things.

Thanks!

It looks like the only supported protocols are currently:
GET, POST, PUT, DELETE according to:
http://www.w3.org/TR/2007/REC-soap12-part2-20070427/ (6.4.3)

Are these sufficient for your needs?
creator: sebb@apache.org

text:
Yes, those four would be fine for my use, and (as the standard method set for
REST interfaces) are likely what's generally useful for others as well.
[Sorry about the delay in answering this.  Finally took a nice long holiday!]
creator: amb@mit.edu

text: *** Bug 53100 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
praumesh86@gmail.com
text: I have trying to do load test on secured webservice but looks like jmeter uses a hardcoded POST call in soap/xml rpc sampler....How can I send a non-post method like for example a get method in soap/xml rpc sampler....Is there a way I can send a get method or there is no way I can send a get method or will this not be fixed at all
Did you try to use HTTP Sampler with Raw Post Body ?
creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
praumesh86@gmail.com
text:
yes and it gave me this error as follow

Response code: Non HTTP response code: java.net.MalformedURLException
Response message: Non HTTP response message: unknown protocol: nightly-k12integrations.pearsoncmg.com

Ask on mailing list.
You are making a mistake in the configuration.
creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com

text:
hi thanks for the help, yes I tried using HTTP Request and I figured it out how to get it working. But I have one more issue and wondering if you can help me with it.

On HTTP Request Sampler I have 

Server Name or IP: abc.def.com

path: /guru/chela/user1/grade?includeDeleted=false

I ran the the test and i got the response as expected.

How can I run this test plan for multiple users under same test plan

I am wondering if there is a way i can read the users from a file so for ever user the path will change according to the users

path:/guru/chela/user2/grade?includeDeleted=false
path:/guru/chela/user3/grade?includeDeleted=false
path:/guru/chela/user4/grade?includeDeleted=false

and so on..
creator: praumesh86@gmail.com
sebb@apache.org
text: Bugzilla is not a support forum. Please ask on the JMeter user mailing list.
how do i do that...who do i email it to
creator: praumesh86@gmail.com

text:
I am emailed list-subscribe@apache.org to add me on subscription list but looks like i didnt get any response.

I would really appreciate if i could get some help on assertion.

For example:
I have 100 users to test.
I run the test for 100 user in 5 seconds interval and save the response in to a file. 

Now, I would like to do a load test with the same 100 users without 5 seconds interval
How can I use assertion or how can i assert that the response I am getting now during the load test matches or contains the same data before.(that was saved to a file)

Another thing that I noticed was, when I use save response to a file. It saves each user response to separate file. Is there a way that I can save all the user response to one single file and later when I run the load test assert the response with that single file.
creator: praumesh86@gmail.com

text:
Please do *not* ask user questions here. Bugzilla is *not* a user forum.

Please read the following page, it contains important information:

http://jmeter.apache.org/mail.html

at the bottom of the page is a link to another page where the mailing lists are described together with details of how to subscribe.

Please do not comment further on this bug.
creator: sebb@apache.org

text:
This one been done as part of HTTP Sampler improvements which ended with 2.10.
Closing as WONTFIX as ths SOAP/XML-RPC Sampler is old now and it is better to use HTTP Request.
creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
